page.title: 13Peculiarities of the River
page.content: We believe it is one of only two rivers in the world which has a "bore":an advancing wall of water which heads the up-tide,upstream of which the level of the river is significantly lower than that of the tidal flow.Depending on the wind direction and strength and the equinoctial state of the tides,the bore travels at 10mph and as it passes it instantly converts the river from half-empty to brim-full.As the leading edge of the bore approaches, its edges slapping the banks,it sounds like an express train rushing round the corners into the watcher's reach. As it goes by,whirlpools and eddies form and reform and the continuing tidal flow quickly but almost imperceptibly raises the level even more so that within an hour or so the full depth for that tide is reached.
